segments.text: How time flies ! We have been in Beijing for almost 4 years .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: yes , I can still recall the days when we were all seniors at college . I asked you whether you would go back to your hometown or not .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: yeah , feels like yesterday . Now I ’ m almost settled down here . We ’ re planning to buy an apartment and tie the knot .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: congratulations ! I hope when you hold the wedding ceremony , I ’ m still residing in Beijing .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: thank you . Is your company going to move to other cities ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: no , I ’ m planning to quit this job and go back to work in my hometown after the spring festival .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: well , I still can ’ t adjust to the fast pace of city life .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: yeah , the hustle and bustle is really difficult to handle .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: that ’ s right . I work extremely hard , and try my best to adapt to the lifestyle here , but I don ’ t feel any sense of belonging here .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I understand your position . Perhaps it ’ s time to stop floating and go back to where you belong . You ’ ll feel much better with your family around .
segments.speaker: S1
